sage.terrain

Class AbstractHeightMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.terrain.AbstractHeightMap
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FaultFractalHeightMap, HillHeightMap, ImageBasedHeightMap, MidPointHeightMap

    public abstract class AbstractHeightMap
extends java.lang.Object
    AbstractHeightMap provides a base implementation of height data for terrain rendering. The loading of the data is dependent on the subclass. The abstract implementation provides a means to retrieve the height data and to save it. It is the general contract of AbstractHeightMap that any subclass provide a means of editing required attributes and calling load again to recreate a heightfield with these new parameters.
    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int edgeSize
      The edgeSize of the height map's width.
      protected float filter
      The filter is used to erode the terrain.
      protected float[] heightData
      Height data information.
      protected float heightScale
      Allows scaling the Y height of the map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractHeightMap

        public AbstractHeightMap()

    • Method Detail

      • getHeightScale

        public float getHeightScale()
        See Also:
        setHeightScale(float)

      • unloadHeightMap

        public void unloadHeightMap()
        unloadHeightMap clears the data of the height map. This insures it is ready for reloading.

      • setHeightScale

        public void setHeightScale(float scale)
        setHeightScale sets the scale of the height values. Typically, the height is a little too extreme and should be scaled to a smaller value (i.e. scaled by 0.25), to produce cleaner slopes.
        Parameters:
        scale - the scale value to multiply height values by.

      • setHeightAtPoint

        public void setHeightAtPoint(float height,
                             int x,
                             int z)
        setHeightAtPoint sets the height value for a given coordinate. It is recommended that the height value be within the 0 - 255 range.
        Parameters:
        height - the new height for the coordinate.
        x - the x (east/west) coordinate.
        z - the z (north/south) coordinate.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        setSize sets the edgeSize of the heightmap, where the area covered by the heightmap is edgeSize x edgeSize.
        Parameters:
        size - the new edgeSize of the heightmap
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the edgeSize is less than or equal to zero.

      • setMagnificationFilter

        public void setMagnificationFilter(float filter)
        setFilter sets the erosion value for the filter. This value must be between 0 and 1, where 0.2 - 0.4 produces arguably the best results.
        Parameters:
        filter - the erosion value.
        Throws:
        RunException - if filter is less than 0 or greater than 1.

      • getTrueHeightAtPoint

        public float getTrueHeightAtPoint(int x,
                                  int z)
        getTrueHeightAtPoint returns the non-scaled value at the point provided.
        Parameters:
        x - the x (east/west) coordinate.
        z - the z (north/south) coordinate.
        Returns:
        the value at (x,z).

      • getScaledHeightAtPoint

        public float getScaledHeightAtPoint(int x,
                                    int z)
        getScaledHeightAtPoint returns the scaled value at the point provided.
        Parameters:
        x - the x (east/west) coordinate.
        z - the z (north/south) coordinate.
        Returns:
        the scaled value at (x, z).

      • getInterpolatedHeight

        public float getInterpolatedHeight(float x,
                                   float z)
        getInterpolatedHeight returns the height of a point that does not fall directly on the height grid. The returned height value is interpolated from the nearest heightmap grid points.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the point.
        z - the y coordinate of the point.
        Returns:
        the interpolated height at this point.

      • getHeightData

        public float[] getHeightData()
        getHeightMap returns the entire grid of height data as an array of floats.
        Returns:
        the grid of height data.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        getSize returns the edgeSize of one side the height map (the area of the height map is edgeSize x edgeSize).
        Returns:
        the edgeSize of a single side.

      • normalizeTerrain

        public void normalizeTerrain(float[][] terrainBuffer,
                             int max)
        normalizeTerrain() takes the terrain data in the specified buffer and normalizes it to values between 0 and the specified maximum.
        Parameters:
        terrainBuffer - the terrain to normalize.
        max - the upper bound of the normalization range.

      • erodeTerrain

        public void erodeTerrain(float[][] tempBuffer)
        erodeTerrain applies a Finite Impulse Response (FIR) filter to a given height map. This effect simulates water erosion in a terrain.
        Parameters:
        tempBuffer - the terrain to filter.
        See Also:
        Finite Impulse Response filters

      • load

        public abstract boolean load()
        load populates the height map data. Each concrete subclass is responsible for providing an implementation of load() which uses the protected edgeSize and heightScale values to compute and assign to protected float [] heightData the height values for this Height Map.
        Returns:
        true if the load was successful, false otherwise.
